title.narrative: COMMUNICATION, ADVOCACY, PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication on child rights issues with stakeholders., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Sri Lanka Country Programme is effectively and efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided tools, guidance and resources for effective communication on child rights issues withstakeholders.

description.narrative: UNICEF capitalized on advocacy to advance the rights of children through engagements with Government and development partners. UNICEF optimized any opportunity, whether a meeting, event or network, to engage on key child rights deprivations identified. During the year, UNICEF conducted several high-level meetings to advocate for addressing key issues facing children, most notably that the COVID-19 pandemic is a child crisis and to get children back to school. These meetings were supported with well-crafted key messages and asks, backed by evidence. UNICEF participated in high level events and leveraged these to demonstrate the need for collaboration on issues affecting children. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:31/01/2022
